item.content:encoded: Really important econ theory paper on personalized medicine: huge huge benefits from AI-driven personalized therapies (oncology is basically predictions of tumor behavior...), but only if regulatory environment focuses on inventive process rather than output.

item.content:encoded: On a per capita basis, there was over TWICE as much fentanyl seized by the Canadians from the USA in 2024, as the reverse! This is an absurd argument to make regarding tariff policies.

item.content:encoded: Google is forced to sell Chrome. Meta buys it. Browsers are only valuable as a means of delivering advertising outcomes, and Meta‚Äôs capabilities surpass all other potential bidders. Meta Chrome incentivizes log-in. Some substantial proportion of Chrome users are now logged in

item.content:encoded: The speed at which Trump‚Äôs supporters went from ‚ÄúHe‚Äôll usher in a new era of American excellence and we will grow GDP 5% forever‚Äù to blind support of running, basically, the South American authoritarian austerity playbook has been shocking to me, and I was pretty cynical already

item.content:encoded: What I find funny about the zero tolerance health arguments is that they make a huge deal about a 2016 study that used covariate adjustment to debunk the health benefits of low volume drinking but even after that control there was no increase in mortality until >4 drinks/day
item.author: Matt Blackwell

item.content:encoded: Analog companies are on the fireline with China competition. TI sees share gain opportunities vs Western peers. Within China, 15% local, 15% TI and 70% western & Japanese suppliers. TI's vertical advantage comes in full force here as TI can price it competitively in even price
item.author: Sravan Kundojjala

item.content:encoded: Dude it‚Äôs Jevons paradox. It‚Äôs literally Baumol‚Äôs cost disease. A classic example of Gell-man amnesia effect. Oh that‚Äôs the Monty Hall Problem. It‚Äôs orthogonal to Dutch Disease. It‚Äôs the Prisoner‚Äôs Dilemma. You‚Äôre a prisoner. You‚Äôre in prison. You‚Äôre imprisoned.

item.content:encoded:
We should probably be asking universities what they plan to do if the feds ask them for lists of named protest participants to deport.
What does the en vogue principle of ‚Äúinstitutional neutralism‚Äù dictate in this context?

item.content:encoded: Not great for my comparative advantage, but from some experiments we have done at Rotman, I am totally convinced the vast majority of research that doesn't involve the physical world can be done more cheaply with AI & a little human intervention than by even good researchers. 1/7
item.author: Kevin A. Bryan
